intro: Chaixia serbica, commonly known as the Serbian chaixia, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to southeastern Europe, particularly found in regions of Serbia and neighboring countries. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a delicate, feathery appearance. Chaixia serbica is often found in open woodlands and along forest edges, thriving in well-drained soils.
